meanings.definition: To deceive or swindle (someone) by cheating or trickery.
meanings.sent1: He was bunkoing his friends by pretending to have a rare toy.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist was caught bunkoing innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was bunkoing the dog by stealing its treats.
meanings.sent4: Her charming smile was bunkoing everyone into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The magician was bunkoing the audience with his clever illusions.

meanings.definition: The act of deceiving or swindling someone by cheating or trickery.
meanings.sent1: The bunkoing of the elderly couple left them heartbroken.
meanings.sent2: She reported the bunkoing to the authorities to seek justice.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about bunkoing a con artist.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises turned out to be nothing but bunkoing.
meanings.sent5: The movie plot revolved around the mastermind's elaborate bunkoing scheme.
